amendment.description: Amendment increases and decreases funding for the Bureau of Labor Statistics by $1 million to allow the Bureau of Labor Statistics to collect data on job loss.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 5 printed in Part B of House Report 116-109 to increase and decrease funding for the Bureau of Labor Statistics by $1 million to allow the Bureau of Labor Statistics to collect data on job loss.

vote.text: On agreeing to the DeSaulnier amendment (A005) Agreed to by recorded vote: 290 - 134 (Roll no. 253).

action.text: Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the DeSaulnier amendment (A005) Agreed to by recorded vote: 290 - 134 (Roll no. 253).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A005) offered by Mr. DeSaulnier.
